subject: Politics
title: The Executive Branch
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Executive Branch usable.

hook.text: Presidents and prime ministers run the show. The executive turns laws on paper into action on the ground.

buildup.text: The executive enforces laws, commands the military, conducts diplomacy, and runs the bureaucracy.

discovery.text: Executive power has grown everywhere. Modern crises demand fast decisions legislatures can't make.

twist.text: Executive overreach is the most common path to democratic decline. Emergency powers become permanent.

climax.text: Even democracies struggle to limit executive power. The temptation to act alone is always present.

punchline.text: Executives act fast. The question is who stops them going too far.

quiz.question: What is the biggest risk of executive power in democracies?
options: Emergency powers become permanent, leading to democratic decline
Executives are too weak to govern effectively
